*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: docs/stations/SHARE_STATION.md
+# Share Station (Broadcast Deck)
+
+Internal name: ShareStation  
+Theme name (Starship Shipyard): Broadcast Deck
+
+## Purpose
+- Help the child package their project into a shareable form (slides, script, comic panels, short write-up).
+- Keep sharing safe, honest, and audience-appropriate.
+
+## Role in the learning loop
+- Ask: who is this for and what format fits (slides/story/comic/video outline)?
+- Plan: outline the story beats and what to show.
+- Act: draft the shareable artefact (text/scripts/panel notes).
+- Review: check for safety (no personal details, truthful claims) and clarity before export.
+
+## Inputs
+- Project mission brief and key steps or outcomes.
+- Audience (friends, class, family) and desired format.
+- Any assets or notes the child wants to include.
+
+## Outputs
+- A short presentation outline or script (e.g., slides, story beats, comic panels).
+- A checklist for a safe share (no personal info, honest claims, kind tone).
+- A reminder to get adult approval before sharing/exporting.
+
+## User experience
+- Feels like a futuristic broadcast studio: panels for “story beats,” “what to show,” and “safety check.”
+- Guides the child through who/what/why, then creates a concise outline.
+- Prompts a final review: “Is this safe and true? Did you remove names/locations?”
+
+## Safety behavior
+- Strips or avoids personal details (names, locations, contact info).
+- Truth over flash: label guesses, avoid exaggeration.
+- Encourages adult/parent/teacher check before exporting or posting.
+- Redirects unsafe requests to safer framing; keeps tone supportive.
+
+## Example child dialogue
+- Child: “I want to show my robot dog comic to my class.”
+- Broadcast Deck: “Great! Who’s the audience? Let’s pick a format—slides or quick story beats?”
+- Child: “Slides.”
+- Broadcast Deck: “Outline: 1) Mission: robot dog saves a kite for friends. 2) How you fixed the panel order with arrows. 3) What you learned: keep speech bubbles short. Safety check: remove names/locations; okay to share with teacher’s approval?”
*** End Patch

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: prompts/stations/share_station_system.txt
+You are the Share Station (Broadcast Deck). You help the child package their project into a safe, honest shareable (slides, script, comic outline, short write-up). Follow the learning loop with emphasis on Ask (audience/format), Plan (story beats), Act (draft outline), Review (safety/clarity).
+Safety Contract: no personal details (names, locations, contacts); truth over flash; kind, encouraging tone; redirect unsafe/harmful topics; remind to get an adult’s approval before exporting or posting; label guesses.
+- Ask who the audience is and choose a simple format.
+- Plan 3–5 beats: mission, how it was built/fixed, what was learned.
+- Draft concise, kid-friendly text; avoid exaggeration; keep it short.
+- Safety check: remove personal info, keep claims honest, flag anything sensitive.
+- End with a reminder: “Have an adult review before sharing.”
*** End Patch

+# FEATURE-WS-0006 Share Station v1 (Broadcast Deck)
+
+## Summary
+First-pass Share Station that helps a child turn their project into a safe, audience-ready outline (slides/story/comic panels) with safety checks and an adult-approval reminder before sharing.
+
+## Scope
+
+- In scope:
+  - Collect audience and desired format; outline 3–5 story beats (mission, build/test highlights, learnings).
+  - Draft concise shareable text (slides/script/story beats) that avoids personal details and exaggeration.
+  - Safety checklist: remove personal info, keep claims truthful, kind tone, adult approval reminder.
+  - Local persistence of share outputs (as StationState: share) when implemented.
+- Out of scope:
+  - Actual export/posting workflows or file generation.
+  - Multimedia uploads/embeds; live presentation tools.
+  - Multiplayer or hosted sharing.
+
+## Affected Stations
+
+- ShareStation
+
+## User Type
+
+- Kid (primary)
+- Mentor/teacher (secondary reviewer)
+
+## Acceptance Criteria
+
+- [ ] Child can specify audience and format and receive a 3–5 beat outline to share.
+- [ ] Drafted content is concise, truthful, and free of personal details; safety reminders are explicit.
+- [ ] Adult approval reminder is present before any sharing/export step.
+- [ ] StationState for “share” can store outline/checklist when wired to persistence.
+- [ ] Prompt follows Safety Contract and Ask→Plan→Act→Review with emphasis on planning communication.
+
+## Links
+
+- Related prompts: prompts/stations/share_station_system.txt
+- Related UI flows: docs/flows/PROJECT_CREATION_FLOW.md, docs/flows/ONBOARDING_FLOW.md
+- Related issues or tickets: (TBD)
*** End Patch

*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: docs/stations/REPLAY_STATION.md
+# Replay Station (Time Tunnels)
+
+Internal name: ReplayStation  
+Theme name (Starship Shipyard): Time Tunnels
+
+## Purpose
+- Let the child rewind through project history to recover or remix past versions without fear.
+- Help compare “then vs. now” to spot what improved and what to bring back.
+
+## Role in the learning loop
+- Ask: which past point do you want to revisit?
+- Reflect: what was different there? what felt better/worse?
+- Plan: choose to restore, branch, or keep current.
+- Act: retrieve or merge content (or add notes to try later).
+- Review: capture what was learned from the comparison.
+
+## Inputs
+- Saved project snapshots or logs (from Memory Station or stored states).
+- Child’s selection of timeframe or version to inspect.
+- Notes on what they’re looking for (e.g., “earlier panel layout,” “old plot idea”).
+
+## Outputs
+- View of prior content (read-only) and a chosen action: keep current, restore, or branch.
+- A new branch or restored version if requested, with clear labeling.
+- A short note on what was learned from the comparison.
+
+## User experience
+- Feels like a holographic time corridor showing checkpoints. The child can peek at each and decide.
+- Presents differences simply (“Changed: panel order, speech bubbles length”).
+- Offers options: “Keep current,” “Restore this part,” or “Create a copy/branch.”
+
+## Safety behavior
+- No blame or regret; frames rewinding as exploration.
+- Warns before overwriting; prefers branching to avoid data loss.
+- Keeps tone calm and reassuring; redirects unsafe or impossible “time travel” asks to safe guidance.
+- Avoids personal details; focuses on project content only.
+
+## Example child dialogue
+- Child: “I liked my old panel order better.”
+- Time Tunnels: “Let’s open that checkpoint. Differences: arrows missing, bubbles shorter. Want to branch a copy with the old order, or just add arrows to the current version?”
+- Child: “Branch a copy.”
+- Time Tunnels: “Done. We made a ‘Panel Order Classic’ branch. What did you learn comparing them?”
*** End Patch

+You are the Replay Station (Time Tunnels). You help the child revisit past versions safely, compare “then vs. now,” and choose to keep, restore, or branch without blame. Follow the loop with emphasis on Ask (which checkpoint), Reflect (what changed), Plan (restore/branch/keep), Act (retrieve/merge), Review (what was learned).
+Safety Contract: calm, reassuring tone; no blame; refuse/redirect unsafe or impossible “time travel” asks; avoid personal details; warn before overwrite; prefer branching to avoid loss; label guesses.
+- Confirm the timeframe/checkpoint to view; show differences simply.
+- Offer options: keep current, restore this part, or branch a copy.
+- Warn before any overwrite; suggest branching to stay safe.
+- Capture one takeaway: “What did you learn comparing these?”
+- Keep it kind and brief; redirect any unsafe topic to a safe, project-focused action.
*** End Patch

*** Add File: docs/features/FEATURE-WS-0007-replay-station-v1.md
+# FEATURE-WS-0007 Replay Station v1 (Time Tunnels)
+
+## Summary
+A first version of the Replay Station that lets a child browse past project checkpoints, compare “then vs. now,” and safely restore or branch content while capturing a learning takeaway.
+
+## Scope
+
+- In scope:
+  - Read-only view of past checkpoints/snapshots (sourced from stored states).
+  - Simple diff/summary of changes to help decide (textual for v1).
+  - Actions: keep current, restore selected content, or create a branch copy.
+  - Safety: warn before overwrite; prefer branching; no blame language.
+  - Store a reflect note about what was learned from the comparison.
+- Out of scope:
+  - Full version control UI; rich diffs or merge tools.
+  - Multiplayer or cloud sync.
+  - Media diffing; audio/video playback.
+
+## Affected Stations
+
+- ReplayStation
+
+## User Type
+
+- Kid (primary)
+- Mentor (secondary)
+
+## Acceptance Criteria
+
+- [ ] Child can select a prior checkpoint and view it without altering current content by default.
+- [ ] Child can choose to restore or branch; branching avoids data loss and labels the copy.
+- [ ] System warns before overwriting; defaults to safe choices.
+- [ ] A reflection/takeaway is captured with the action.
+- [ ] Prompt and UI follow the Safety Contract; tone remains calm and blame-free.
+
+## Links
+
+- Related prompts: prompts/stations/replay_station_system.txt
+- Related stations: Memory Station (source of checkpoints/logs)
+- Related issues or tickets: (TBD)
*** End Patch

payload.message:
Implemented Phase 0/1 scaffolding and WebLLM runtime bootstrap.

Key additions
- Runtime/LLM core: `app/src/runtime/llm/model_manifest.json`, `model_config.ts`, `webllm_loader.ts` (streaming adapter outputs `{ token, done }`, safety scrub/tag, stub WebLLM loader with model selection).
- Global AI context: `app/src/runtime/ai/AIProvider.tsx` with model selection and streaming.
- Stores: `app/src/stores/projectStore.ts`, `aiStore.ts`, `uiStore.ts` (simple event-bus hooks).
- App shell & navigation: Vite/TS/Tailwind scaffold (`app/index.html`, `vite.config.ts`, `tsconfig*.json`, `tailwind.config.js`, `postcss.config.cjs`, `src/styles/index.css`), router shell (`app/src/main.tsx`, `app/src/App.tsx`), nav overlay (`app/src/components/NavOverlay.tsx`), and placeholders for all stations (`app/src/pages/IdeaDock.tsx`, `AssemblyBay.tsx`, `DiagnosticsCorridor.tsx`, `StellarArchive.tsx`, `OrbiterBridge.tsx`, `BroadcastDeck.tsx`, `TimeTunnels.tsx`).
- Station registry updates: `app/frontend/src/domain/project.ts`, `docs/DATA_MODEL.md` now include `share` and `replay`.
- New station docs/prompts/features:
  - Share/Broadcast Deck: `docs/stations/SHARE_STATION.md`, `prompts/stations/share_station_system.txt`, `docs/features/FEATURE-WS-0006-share-station-v1.md`.
  - Replay/Time Tunnels: `docs/stations/REPLAY_STATION.md`, `prompts/stations/replay_station_system.txt`, `docs/features/FEATURE-WS-0007-replay-station-v1.md`.
- Changelog: `roadmap/CHANGELOG.md` notes Share and Replay additions.

Notes
- WebLLM calls are stubbed; swap `createStubEngine` with real WebLLM engine later.
- Tailwind/Vite configs are present but no packages installed; run installs when ready.
- No git add/commit performed.

payload.text:
**Noting stubs, missing dependencies, and next steps**

WebLLM is currently stubbed in the loader with projectStore event bus also involved; the new front-end uses a Vite scaffold but lacks installed dependencies. Next steps include replacing stubs with the real WebLLM engine, implementing real persistence, and removing placeholder pages to prepare for production readiness.

payload.message:
Observations from a quick validation pass:
- The LLM runtime is still stubbed. In `app/src/runtime/llm/webllm_loader.ts`, `createStubEngine()` just splits the prompt and streams tokens; this is a mock, not real WebLLM inference. No actual model loading or WebLLM API is wired yet.
- Global stores (`projectStore`, `aiStore`, `uiStore`) are simple event-bus placeholders; there’s no real persistence or integration with the existing `app/frontend` data or local storage.
- UI pages are placeholders (static text) with no logic; navigation exists, but stations don’t render real content yet.
- Build tooling is scaffolded (Vite/Tailwind configs, entrypoint), but dependencies are not installed and Tailwind/Shadcn/Radix are not set up beyond config files.

What to fix to remove mocks:
1) Replace `createStubEngine` with the actual WebLLM engine init and hook up streaming generation; verify Phi-3 Mini, Qwen2.5 1.5B, TinyLlama are reachable.
2) Implement real persistence for projects/steps and align the new app store layer with the existing `app/frontend` data model (or migrate fully).
3) Flesh out station pages with actual UI and data wiring; connect to AIProvider where needed.
4) Install and configure dependencies (Vite/React/TS/Tailwind/shadcn/Radix/React Router) to make the scaffold runnable.

{
  "sequence": "007",
  "id": "WS-CODEX-007",
  "phase": "Scaffolding Bridge: Data Model Integration",
  "title": "Implement Project Persistence Layer and Local Storage Adapter",
  "summary": "Replace placeholder projectStore with a full domain model, storage adapter, autosave, and alignment to Workshop ATLAS terminology.",
  "instructions": "You must follow the WORKSHOP_ATLAS.MD terminology and the SAFETY_CONTRACT.md rules.

Goal for this task:
Implement a real domain shape and persistence layer so that projects, steps, reflections, and tests survive reloads and can be safely extended by later stations.

Perform these steps:

1) Create domain folder and types
   - Create a folder: app/src/domain/
   - Add TypeScript models:
     - project.ts
     - step.ts
     - reflection.ts
     - test.ts
     - archive.ts
   - Define interfaces for:
     - Project
     - Goal
     - Step
     - Reflection
     - TestResult
     - ArchiveEntry
   - Keep these types small and focused, with comments that reference the Workshop ATLAS concepts (Idea Station, Build Station, etc).

2) Implement ID helper
   - Add a small helper (for example in app/src/domain/id.ts) that wraps nanoid or a similar tiny ID generator.
   - Use this helper for all new Project, Step, Reflection, TestResult, and ArchiveEntry IDs.

3) Implement local storage adapter
   - Create app/src/runtime/storage/local_storage_adapter.ts.
   - Implement functions:
     - saveProject(project: Project): Promise<void>
     - loadProject(id: string): Promise<Project | null>
     - listProjects(): Promise<Project[]>
     - deleteProject(id: string): Promise<void>
   - Use window.localStorage under a single key namespace like "workshop.projects".
   - Handle missing or malformed data defensively: never throw, always repair or return safe defaults.

4) Wire projectStore to the adapter
   - Update or create projectStore so it no longer holds a purely in-memory map.
   - On initialization, call listProjects() to populate state.
   - When creating, updating, or deleting projects, always call the adapter.
   - Ensure that the active project ID is saved (for example under "workshop.activeProjectId") so it can be restored on reload.

5) Autosave behavior
   - Ensure that whenever a Step, Reflection, or TestResult is updated, the owning Project is saved.
   - Keep autosave behavior simple and predictable; you may debounce writes lightly, but do not use complex queues for v1.

Respect the Creativity Boundary spec:
   - Before saving, clamp text lengths and counts to the limits described there.
   - Document truncation behavior with comments so it is easy to reason about later.

Do not design station UIs in this task. Focus only on domain types, the adapter, and projectStore wiring.",
  "acceptance_criteria": [
    "app/src/domain/ defines Project, Goal, Step, Reflection, TestResult, and ArchiveEntry types aligned with Workshop ATLAS terminology.",
    "An ID helper exists and is used for new entities.",
    "local_storage_adapter.ts implements saveProject, loadProject, listProjects, and deleteProject using localStorage safely.",
    "projectStore initialization and mutation paths now depend on the adapter rather than in-memory-only state.",
    "Active project ID is persisted and restored, and autosave persists edits to steps, reflections, and tests."
  ]
}

payload.message:
Implemented WS-CODEX-007: real domain types and persistent project storage with autosave.

- Domain models: added `app/src/domain/{project,step,reflection,test,archive}.ts` and `id.ts` (UUID helper). Types align to Workshop stations and loop.
- Storage adapter: `app/src/runtime/storage/local_storage_adapter.ts` persists projects under `workshop.projects`, clamps text/counts (Creativity Boundary guard), saves/loads/lists/deletes safely, and tracks active project ID.
- Project store: `app/src/stores/projectStore.ts` now initializes from localStorage, persists on create/update/delete, keeps active project ID, and autosaves step/reflection/test updates via adapter.
- Station enums already include new stations; currentStation handled in store actions.

Files added/updated: `app/src/domain/*`, `app/src/runtime/storage/local_storage_adapter.ts`, `app/src/stores/projectStore.ts`.

Uncommitted changes only.

C. UPDATE MAIN AND CREATE BRANCH
--------------------------------------------------

6. Ensure main is current:

   - Run:
     - git checkout main
     - git pull --ff-only

   - If git pull fails due to conflicts or non-fast-forward:
     - Print the error.
     - STOP. Do NOT proceed.

7. Create a new branch for this prompt:

   - Let BRANCH_NAME = "prompt-" + PROMPT_SEQ
     Example: "prompt-007"

   - Run:
     - git checkout -b BRANCH_NAME

   - If branch creation fails, print the error and STOP.

--------------------------------------------------
D. EXECUTE THE PROMPT INSTRUCTIONS
--------------------------------------------------

8. Read PROMPT_INSTRUCTIONS carefully.
   - Treat it as the single source of truth for what to change.
   - DO NOT perform tasks that are not explicitly required.
   - DO NOT anticipate future prompts.
   - Only modify:
     - Files that PROMPT_INSTRUCTIONS explicitly tells you to touch, OR
     - Files that must be adjusted to keep imports/compilation correct.

9. Apply the instructions step by step:
   - Create new files in the exact paths specified.
   - Update existing files with minimal, focused edits.
   - Keep naming aligned with the repository conventions already present.
   - Where the prompt refers to other docs (for example WORKSHOP_ATLAS.MD, SAFETY_CONTRACT.md), read them if needed for context and match their terminology.

10. After edits, run:

    - git status

    - Print the list of created/modified/deleted files.

--------------------------------------------------
E. SELF-CHECK AGAINST ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA
--------------------------------------------------

11. For each item in PROMPT_CRITERIA:

    - Explicitly verify whether it is satisfied.
    - For each criterion, print:
      - "[OK]" or "[MISSING]" followed by the text of the criterion.
    - If something is missing, fix it if you can do so safely without scope creep.
    - If you cannot satisfy it without guessing or large redesigns, explain why.

12. If this repository has scripts like:
    - npm test
    - npm run lint
    - npm run build

    Then:

    - Run npm run lint if it exists.
    - Run npm test if it exists.
    - If any of these fail, print the errors clearly.
    - DO NOT silently ignore failures.

--------------------------------------------------
F. COMMIT AND PUSH
--------------------------------------------------

13. If everything above is complete, stage and commit:

    - Run:
      - git add .

    - Run:
      - git commit -m "Prompt PROMPT_SEQ"

      Example:
      - git commit -m "Prompt 007"

    - If commit fails due to no changes:
      - Print "No changes to commit for this prompt."
      - STOP.

14. Push the branch:

    - Run:
      - git push -u origin BRANCH_NAME

    - If push fails (for example no remote or auth issues), print the error and STOP, but DO NOT undo work.

--------------------------------------------------
G. FINAL REPORT
--------------------------------------------------

15. At the end, print a concise final report with:

    - Prompt ID and title:
      - "Completed PROMPT_ID (Prompt PROMPT_SEQ): PROMPT_TITLE"
    - Branch name:
      - "Branch: BRANCH_NAME"
    - Commit message:
      - "Commit: 'Prompt PROMPT_SEQ'"
    - Files changed (short list).
    - Acceptance criteria summary with each [OK]/[MISSING].
    - Any known warnings (failing tests, TODOs, or follow-up suggestions).

16. After printing the final report:
    - STOP.
    - Do not start any new tasks.
    - Wait for the human operator to decide the next prompt.

--------------------------------------------------
H. NOW WAIT FOR CURRENT_PROMPT
--------------------------------------------------

Now wait for CURRENT_PROMPT JSON.
Do not act until you see a JSON object with keys:
sequence, id, phase, title, summary, instructions, acceptance_criteria.
